content:
✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: quite fun!

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: Looks nice for a clash

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: fun, perfect for a clash of code

quite fun. 

* you could add a test case with only one element in the list
* the other remarks I had are already made by 5DN1L

Goal
* Please remove the example. An example has been shown in Example section.

* More explanation is needed. For example, consider adding the following text:
You may visualise the construction of the list as follows:
• Write down the smallest number.
• The next bigger number is written on the <<right>>.
• The next bigger number is written on the <<left>> of the smallest number.
• The next bigger number is written on the <<right>> of the three written numbers.
• Continue writing down the remaining numbers in ascending order by alternating between <<left>> and <<right>>.

Input
* Please delete "nums is an unordered list , this list may include letters." There aren't any letters, and this description does not describe the input fully.

* Please write the following instead:

<<Line 1>>: An integer [[N]] for the number of integers in the unordered list [[nums]]
<<Line 2>>: The unordered list [[nums]] which contains [[N]] space-separated integers

Constraints
* Please mention the range of the numbers in [[nums]] like this (fill in the lower and upper limits):
??? ≤ each number in [[nums]] ≤ ???

Cases
* Please revise each pair of test and validator so that they are similar (in terms of the length of the lists) but not the same.

* Consider having more variety of the length of the lists.

Stub generator
* In Line 2, please use loopline to parse the numbers. Reference: https://www.codingame.com/playgrounds/40701/help-center/stub-generator

Thanks.
